tossups.question: Books used in this activity are the best-known product of Spanish publishing company Lynx Edicions. tossups.answer_sanitized: birding [or birdwatching; prompt on twitching; prompt on ornithology]

tossups.question: Two answers required. A preference for one of these two molecules over the other is represented by the specificity factor of rbcL (“R-B-C-L”), which is frequently used in DNA barcoding. tossups.answer: carbon dioxide AND diatomic oxygen [accept CO2 in place of “carbon dioxide”; accept O2 or oxygenase in place of “oxygen”; prompt on carboxyl or carboxylase for “carbon dioxide”]

parts: Give these two constants, which are often found multiplied by the temperature. The ratio between these two constants is Avogadro’s number.
The choice of constant determines the units of this quantity, as the expressions kT and RT take its units. The SI unit for this quantity is the joule.

Boltzmann’s constant often appears in exponents of this form, which are ubiquitous in science. The exponent of the Boltzmann factor is in this form, as are the exponents of the Arrhenius and Eyring equations. Give your answer in terms of the energy E, the temperature T, and either Boltzmann’s constant or the ideal gas constant.

parts: Name this city, which was nicknamed "Porkopolis" for its dominance of the pig industry in the US prior to the Civil War.
After the Civil War, this city surpassed Cincinnati in pork production, in large part due to its advantageous position on Lake Michigan and status as a railroad hub.

Another major Chicago industry was wheat, the easy storage and sale of which was enabled by this invention. William Cronon detailed how this invention enabled the Chicago futures market in his book Nature's Metropolis.

it does not border land [accept answers indicating that the edges of the Sargasso Sea are not defined by coastlines or that it is in the middle of the Atlantic ocean]
parts: Name this genus of brown seaweed often found floating at sea.

Genus Sargassum lends its name to the Sargasso Sea, which has this geographical distinction. As the only sea with this characteristic, the Sargasso is bound by the Gulf Stream and other currents of the North Atlantic gyre.

Despite the exceptional clarity of its waters, these animals have never been sighted as they breed in the Sargasso. The life cycle of these long, narrow fish in genus Anguilla has mystified scientists for centuries, stumping luminaries like Aristotle and a young Sigmund Freud.

Despite the exceptional clarity of its waters, these animals have never been sighted as they breed in the Sargasso. The life cycle of these long, narrow fish in genus Anguilla has mystified scientists for centuries, stumping luminaries like Aristotle and a young Sigmund Freud.
